venn.graph
Class HistogramStatR1

java.lang.Object
  venn.graph.Histogram
      venn.graph.HistogramStatR1
Direct Known Subclasses:
HistogramAdaptR1
public class HistogramStatR1
extends Histogram

This class comes from a refactoring of Histogram, HistogramStats, HistogramAdapt, and HistogramMedian.

Constructor Detail

HistogramStatR1

public HistogramStatR1(int num_bins,
                       double lo,
                       double hi)
The constructor will create an array of a given number of bins. The range of the histogram given by the upper and lower limit values.

Parameters:
numBins - number of bins for the histogram.
lo - lowest value of bin.
hi - highest value of bin.

HistogramStatR1

public HistogramStatR1(java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String xLabel,
                       int num_bins,
                       double lo,
                       double hi)
Constructor with title and x axis label.

Parameters:
title - histogram title
xLabel - label for x axis of histogram.
numBins - number of bins for the histogram.
lo - lowest value of bin.
hi - highest value of bin.

getMin

public int getMin()
Get the number of entries in the smallest bin.

Overrides:
getMin in class Histogram

add

public void add(double x)
Add an entry to a bin. Include if value is in the range lo <= x < hi

Overrides:
add in class Histogram
Parameters:
x - double value added if it is in the range: lo <= x < hi

clear

public void clear()
Clear the histogram bins and the over and under flows.

Overrides:
clear in class Histogram

getStats

public double[] getStats()
Get the average and standard deviation from the distribution of the bins rather than from the individual data inputs as in getStats () method. Overflows and underflows ignored.

If histogram empty, all values set to zero.

Overrides:
getStats in class Histogram
Returns:
double array

getDataStats

public double[] getDataStats()
Get the statistical measures of the distribution calculated from the individual entry values (except the median).

Returns:
values in double array correspond to

1 - mean
2 - std. dev
3 - error on the mean
4 - skewness
5 - kurtosis
6 - median

The median is calculated from the bin distribution.

getMedian

public double getMedian()
The median is calculated from the bin distribution. Overflows and underflows ignored.

getBinErrors

public double[] getBinErrors()
Provide an array of error values for all bins.

Returns:
array of double values.

getBinError

public double getBinError(int bin)
Return the error for a particular bin.

Parameters:
from - 0 to highest bin value

makeBinErrors

public void makeBinErrors()
Calculate the error on each bin according to the sqrt (bin contents) from std. dev. of Poisson distribution.

packErrors

public boolean packErrors(double[] errors)
Pack the errors on each bin.

Parameters:
false - if array size doesn't match number of bins.
